definition: to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
hair/drawing brush/(in the) least/one thousandth/currency unit, 0.1 yuan

sentences.english: I paint, but only to find itself, has nothing to do with people.
sentences.chinese: 我的揮毫，只是尋找自在而已，與人無關。

sentences.english: Let us not forget that the painter's brushstroke is something in which a movement is terminated.
sentences.chinese: 我們不要忘記，畫家的揮毫是動作被終止的某件東西。

sentences.english: Be in charge of paint, in a thin biscuit sketched by pure love.
sentences.chinese: 執管揮毫，在薄薄的素坯上勾勒出潔白無暇的愛情。

sentences.english: Can you paint with all the colors of the wind ?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾用風之色彩潑墨揮毫？

sentences.english: Can you paint with all the colors of the wind ? Can you paint with all the colors of the wind ?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾用風之色彩潑墨揮毫？

sentences.english: The participants can either may engage in joint creation or improvise on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 書畫筆會可聯合創作或即席揮毫。

definition: to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)
Gentlemen! (start of a speech)/Ladies and Gentlemen!
to take up one's pen/to start to write
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
